title: #1 Measure you Calibre

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(5 \times 3^m) + 4 = n^2 \\
\implies (5 \times 3^m) = (n+2)(n-2) "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Notice that LHS has two coprime factors. In the RHS "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{gcd}(n+2,n-2) = \text{gcd}(4,n+2)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{gcd}(a+b,a-b) = \text{gcd}(a+b,2b) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), here, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n+2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" should be odd which means that gcd is 1, hence RHS must contain both factors coprime as well. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n+2 = 5 \implies n=3 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n-2 = 5 \implies n=7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can check that"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=3 \to 5 \times 3^m = 5 \implies m = 0 \ (m : m \in \mathbb{Z}, m \ge 0) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=7 \to 5 \times 3^m = 45 \implies m = 2 \ (m : m \in \mathbb{Z}, m \ge 0) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus the sum is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3+7 = 10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            To fill in the gap, notice that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" gcd(n+2, n-2) = \gcd (4, n+2) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a factor of 4. Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n+2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is odd, hence the gcd = 1, thus they are coprime. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note: You also have to check that the other factor is a power of 3.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Can you show that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \gcd (n,m) = \gcd (n, n+m) = \gcd ( n, m-n) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?   "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"More generally, for any integer X, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \gcd (n,m) = \gcd (n, m+Xn) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Check out the "},{"type":"text","text":"greatest common divisor","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" wiki for more information :)

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 1 More
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/23e58cee4b.2a1169e094.Pz3lNg.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
What is 1 - 1 + 1 - 1 + 1 - 1 + ... 
if the pattern it has remains constant and goes on indefinitely? 
State your answer in decimal form if necessary."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let's set this term to x. Then, 1 - x equals 1 - (1-1+1...). Distributing 1-x yields equals 1-1+1-1+1 ... .
Here's where the magic begins. The term on the right side is equivalent to x. There fore, 1 - x = x --> 2x = 1.
Dividing gives x = 0.5."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1 more day to Valentine
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\large (a^2-ab+b^2)(b^2-bc+c^2)(c^2-ac+a^2)\\leq\\frac{m}{n}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"\nIf "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are non-negative reals satisfying "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are coprime positive integers, find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m+n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Call the expression above is P
By applying AM-GM we have:
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P\leq a^2b^2(a^2-ab+b^2)=\frac{4}{9}(\frac{\frac{3}{2}ab+\frac{3}{2}ab+a^2-ab+b^2}{3})"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=\frac{4}{9}\frac{(a+b)^6}{27}\leq \frac{4(a+b+c)^6}{243}=\frac{256}{243} =\frac{m}{n}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\LARGE m+n=499"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Another way
Without losing the generally,we may assume that c=min{a,b,c}
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2-ac+c^2\leq (a+\frac{c}{2})^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b^2-bc+c^2\leq (b+\frac{c}{2})^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2-ab+b^2\leq (a+\frac{c}{2})^2-(a+\frac{c}{2})(b+\frac{c}{2})+(b+\frac{c}{2})^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=a+\frac{c}{2};y=b+\frac{c}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x+y=a+b+c=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P\leq x^2y^2(x^2-xy+y^2)=x^2(2-x)^2[x^2-x(2-x)+(2-x)^2]"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=3x^6-12x^5+36x^4-40x^3+16x^2\leq \frac{256}{243}=\frac{m}{n}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\LARGE m+n=499"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @P C – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" After expanding everything and clearing terms, "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2-ab+b^2\leq (a+\frac{c}{2})^2-(a+\frac{c}{2})(b+\frac{c}{2})+(b+\frac{c}{2})^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^{2}-ab+b^{2} \leq a^{2}+\frac{c^{2}}{4}+ca-ab-\frac{ac}{2}-\frac{bc}{2}-\frac{c^{2}}{4}+b^{2}+\frac{c^{2}}{4}+bc"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0\leq \frac{ac}{2}+\frac{bc}{2}+\frac{c^{2}}{4}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" happens to be correct."}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"However, the way the solution is phrased is easy to cause misunderstanding. Initially, I also struggled to see why the above inequality is true. "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

                                            I have fixed my problem.Maybe I'm wrong while I am typing

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

Do you mind explaining the first part ?(How do you use AM-GM in such mind-boggling way)."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why??"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

  "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P\leq x^2y^2(x^2-xy+y^2)=x^2(2-x^2)[x^2-x(2-x)+(2-x)^2]"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"
"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

  "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P\leq x^2y^2(x^2-xy+y^2)=x^2(2-x)^2[x^2-x(2-x)+(2-x)^2]"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 1 more toss
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If you toss a fair coin "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" times and I toss it "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" times, what is the probability that you get more heads? If the answer can be expressed as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\frac{a}{b}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are coprime, find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]}

title: 1 move, big change
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is an "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"-digit number having the property that the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is doubled if the last digit of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is moved to the front."}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the smallest possible value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the last digit of a number "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10a+b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Then for some "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10^x b + a=2(10a+b)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"which means that "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=\dfrac{19a}{10^x-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a single digit, the smallest "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for which  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10^x-2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"19"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as a factor is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=17"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so that the number is "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"52631578947368420b+b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" leads to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"52631578947368421"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the double of which is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"105263157894736842"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we try the next value "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which leads to "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"105263157894736842"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the double of which is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"210526315789473684"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"One solution for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n = 18"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = 105263157894736842"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", since:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/sTmDAzAXGm-cyclic2.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" value can be found with its last digit "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as a seed using the following algorithm.  First, start with the seed "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and add it to itself to obtain "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2 + 2 = 4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/DW4K6giMkA-cyclic2a.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then take the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and place it in the next column and add it to itself to obtain "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4 + 4 = 8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/wRtS2mL2Ec-cyclic2b.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then take the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and place it in the next column and add it to itself to obtain "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8 + 8 = 16"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Put down the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and carry the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/BsITftqlHQ-cyclic2c.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then take the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and place it in the next column and add it to itself (along with the carried "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":") to obtain "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6 + 6 + 1 = 13"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Put down the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and carry the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/7NGWku6PUq-cyclic2d.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Continue this process until you obtain the original seed "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (without a carried "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":").  The result, with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"18"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digits, is the first image in this solution."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now we can use this algorithm to test all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digits and show that if it is possible they all result in solutions with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"18"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digits: "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/phTVxWCPCK-cyclicchart.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(Exceptions: The seed "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" results in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which does not have a last digit to move to the front, so it is discounted.  Also, technically the seed "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" results in an "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" value with a leading "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", but the leading "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is necessary for the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" value, so the number of digits is still "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n = 18"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since all possible seeds result in solutions "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" values with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"18"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digits, the smallest possible "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" value is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n = \boxed{18}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Incidentally, all the possible solutions for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" have all the digits in the same order, and is an 18-digit "},{"type":"text","text":"cyclic number","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1/n
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If we write down some different odd positive integers, so that none of them is 1, is it possible that the sum of their reciprocals is 1?"}]}]}

title: 1/n now is a problem
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Is it possible, that if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_1<a_2<a_3<a_4<\\dots<a_{2017}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are positive integers, then\n"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\dfrac{1}{a_1}-\\dfrac{1}{a_2}=\\dfrac{1}{a_2}-\\dfrac{1}{a_3}=\\dfrac{1}{a_3}-\\dfrac{1}{a_4}=\\dots =\\dfrac{1}{a_{2016}}-\\dfrac{1}{a_{2017}}?"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Define the sequence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by the following:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_n=\frac{k}{N-n}, \ 1 \leq n<N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are fixed positive integers."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We'll prove that for some appropiate "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" this sequence fulfills the problem's conditions."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First, we seek to show that the difference "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{a_i}-\frac{1}{a_{i+1}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" does not depend on the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Indeed,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{a_i}-\frac{1}{a_{i+1}} = \frac{N-i}{k}-\frac{N-i-1}{k} = \frac{1}{k}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Letting "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k=N!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" it follows that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{N-n} | k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for every "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 \leq n<N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", hence the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_n=\frac{k}{N-n}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a positive integer. Since the condition "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_i<a_{i+1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the simple consequence of the fact that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{k}{N-i} < \frac{k}{N-i-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we have shown that this sequence is a correct solution for any "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Putting in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N=2018"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we are done."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1- Numbering a Square
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/20cf030b8e.356a192b79.DY19pm.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"\nPaula has numbered all squares of the square board above, from left to right and top to bottom, starting with the number 1. The central square received the number 5. If she does the same with another square board divided by 49 squares, which number will be written on the central square?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In the First Pattern, there were 9 boxes and the central number will be (9+1)/2=5. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
For n boxes, the central Number will be (n+1)/2. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
For 49 boxes, central no=(49+1)/2=25"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For 49 Square board ,this becomes a grid of 7X7..We take middle no of top row that is 4,so next column will be added 7 number and therefore the central square will be  4 +7+7+7 =25 Ans
K.K.GARG,India"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            i also do the same process...... hehehe....

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"It's actually asking for the median, or the second quarter of a series, in which the formula for the position of the median is Q2= (n+1)/2. Since the data is ordered and and changes by one, we know that any position the data set is equal to its value.
Since n=49
(49+1)/2=25
Meaning that 25 will be in the centre."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In the given pattern of 3*3 matrix, position of middle term can be given as 3/2=1.5(round off to 2), i.e; middle term is on (2,2) position in the matrix. Now for the value of that middle term we have
        n^2+(n-1)^2          where, n=position of middle term"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, for the given pattern of 7*7 matrix
       position of middle term = 7/2= 3.5(round off to 4 )
  hence,    value of middle term = n^2+(n-1)^2
                                                           = 4^2 + (4-1)^2
                                                           = 25"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A square board with 49 squares has to be a 7x7 grid (7 squared)."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The median (middle) number in 7 is the 4th number. The last number after three rows is 21 (7x3). "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This means that the 4th number in the 4th row is 25."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Well, a unique central square will exist only if dimension is n x n , where n is odd and hence n^2 will be the total no. of squares or the last no. of the board.
To find the central no., we can count all the squares till just before the middle row(i.e. (((n-1)/2)"},{"type":"text","text":"n) and then adding the middle element of the row(i.e. (n+1)/2)....
Mathematically,   central no.= (n-1)","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"n/2+(n+1)/2
                                                       =(n^2+1)/2
                         or simply,            = (Total no. of squares in the board+1)/2"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So in this problem, as total no. of squares is 49, 
 the central no. will be = (49+1)/2
                                           =25    Ans."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hope it helps"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1-Number Numbers
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The smallest positive integer that have digits which are all the same and is a multiple of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"49"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can be expressed as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" what is the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\frac{a}{49}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]}]}
